name: Halibur
armor_class_notes: Chain Mail AC is fixed at 16; Dexterity modifier is +0

Strength.notes: Primary stat for melee attacks and damage

Dexterity.notes: Used for ranged attacks and AC

Constitution.notes: Affects hit points and Constitution saves

Intelligence.notes: Used for knowledge skills, saves, spell DC

Wisdom.notes: Used for perception, insight, and some saves

Charisma.notes: Affects social interactions and Charisma saves

class_features.Second Wind: Bonus action to regain 1d10 + fighter level HP once per short/long rest
class_features.Action Surge: Take one extra action (not magical) once per short/long rest

maneuvers.name: Menacing Attack
maneuvers.effect: Add Superiority Die to damage; target must make Wisdom save or be frightened until end of next turn

maneuvers.name: Disarming Attack
maneuvers.effect: Add Superiority Die to damage; next attack against target before your next turn has Advantage

maneuvers.name: Trip Attack
maneuvers.effect: Add Superiority Die to damage; target must make Strength save or be knocked prone

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.notes: Can be thrown (20/60), or used one-handed or two-handed

weapons.name: Sunpiercer
weapons.description: Sunpiercer is a rare, magical spear crafted from polished white ash with silver inlays and tipped with a radiant crystal spearhead. It glows with a warm, inner light. While wielding Sunpiercer, you emit bright light for 10 feet and dim light for another 10 feet. This light counts as sunlight, can be toggled as a bonus action, and is useful for dispelling magical darkness and damaging sunlight-sensitive creatures. The weapon grants +1 to attack and damage rolls, and allows the wielder to expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage. It regains 1d3 charges at dawn. Lore speaks of it being forged from celestial forces and used to banish shadows, ward off darkness, and reveal hidden truths. It glows more brightly in the presence of evil or deceit.

rest_tracking.format: Each column is a rest event; use S or L at top, mark 'X' for use, 'r' for regain
